data.text:
My forgotten tools (found on my Tool-Stick

KM-Net Viewer (for Printers)

Tool for Network Printer Status

http://www.kyoceradocumentsolutions.com.au/SUPPORT/Pages/LegacyUtilities.aspx

Other forgotten Tools:

Glint - http://community.spiceworks.com/how_to/show/2996-display-cpu-ram-and-net-utilization-of-other-computer-with-glint

Network Scanner - http://community.spiceworks.com/how_to/show/14284-comfortable-wake-on-lan-wol-remote-shutdown-and-net-send-to-multiple-devices

WLAN Kloner - http://community.spiceworks.com/how_to/show/25004-export-import-wireless-network-profile-with-wlan-kloner

Driver Deleter for Printers - http://community.spiceworks.com/how_to/show/26367-delete-all-driver-and-info-for-selected-printers

Step 1: Download, Depack and Install

Download:https://www.kyoceradocumentsolutions.de/index/serviceworld/downloadcenter.false.utility.KM2560._.DE.html

Unpack the zip file

Install: run setup.exe

Step 2: Modeltypes

Show not only Kyocera types (also: HP, Canon, Sharp, OKI …)

Model

Printer status

IP, MAC …

Step 3: Additional

Memory

printed pages

Toner level

if nessesary

Step 4: Additional

printer name

serial number

if nessesary

pages per minute

Step 5: nice status pictures

sleep

no paper

offline

…

Step 6: more

scan the network

create report

start the printer-status-website

or the “Kyocera” Status Page (only for Kyo Printer)

Helpful tool as as an additional control besides Spiceworks.

I use the 4.7 version because they detect more types of other manufacturer

The KMNet tool is a nice little tool, found it when we bought some Kyocera Printers.

They also build good Japanese ceramic knives.

Thank you for these particulars: I will try as soon as possible.

a great tool I use it also!

They build all kinds of things from printers to knives to solar panels to cell phones. amazing company really

Got new tools for my arsenal.

Appreciate the guide, thank you.
